intro: Beloakon luteum, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a flowering plant characterized by its striking yellow-orange petals and bell-shaped blooms. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is native to certain regions of southern Africa. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in a fine, silvery down, adding to its ornamental appeal. Beloakon luteum is often cultivated for its vibrant flowers and drought tolerance.
